	Red		- connection disabled

name: ai_show_grid
help: Draw a grid on the floor where looking.

name: ai_step
help: NPCs will freeze after completing their current task.  To complete the next task, use 'ai_step' again.  To resume processing normally use 'ai_resume'

name: ai_resume
help: If NPC is stepping through tasks (see ai_step ) will resume normal processing.

name: ai_next_hull
help:
Cycles through the various hull sizes.  Currently selected hull size is written to the screen.  Controls which connections are shown when ai_show_hull or ai_show_connect commands are used
	Arguments:	-none-

name: ai_hull
help:
Controls which connections are shown when ai_show_hull or ai_show_connect commands are used
	Arguments:	NPC name or classname, <none>=NPC under crosshair

name: ai_nodes
help:
Toggles node display.  First call displays the nodes for the given network as green objects.  Second call  displays the nodes and their IDs.  Nodes are color coded as follows:
	Green		- ground node
	Cyan		- air node
	Magenta	- climb node
	Grey		- node not available for selected hull size
	Orange 	- node currently locked

name: ai_show_node
help: Highlight the specified node

name: ai_show_visibility
help: Toggles visibility display for the node that the player is looking at.  Nodes that are visible from the selected node will be drawn in red with yellow lines connecting to the selected node.  Nodes that are not visible from the selected node will be drawn in blue.

name: ai_show_graph_connect
help: Toggles graph connection display for the node that the player is looking at.  Nodes that are connected to the selected node by the net graph will be drawn in red with magenta lines connecting to the selected node.  Nodes that are not connected via the net graph from the selected node will be drawn in blue.

name: npc_bipass
help:
Displays the local movement attempts by the given NPC(s) (triangulation detours).  Failed bypass routes are displayed in red, successful bypasses are shown in green.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at.

name: npc_destroy
help:
Removes the given NPC(s) from the universe
Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc_class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_kill
help:
Kills the given NPC(s)
Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc_class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_enemies
help:
Shows memory of NPC.  Draws an X on top of each memory.
	Eluded entities drawn in blue (don't know where it went)
	Unreachable entities drawn in green (can't get to it)
	Current enemy drawn in red
	Current target entity drawn in magenta
	All other entities drawn in pink
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_focus
help:
Displays red line to NPC's enemy (if has one) and blue line to NPC's target entity (if has one)
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_create
help:
Creates an NPC of the given type where the player is looking (if the given NPC can actually stand at that location).  Note that this only works for npc classes that are already in the world.  You can not create an entity that doesn't have an instance in the level.
	Arguments:	{npc_class_name}

name: npc_create_aimed
help:
Creates an NPC aimed away from the player of the given type where the player is looking (if the given NPC can actually stand at that location).  Note that this only works for npc classes that are already in the world.  You can not create an entity that doesn't have an instance in the level.
	Arguments:	{npc_class_name}

name: npc_destroy_unselected
help: Removes all NPCs from the universe that aren't currently selected

name: npc_freeze
help:
Selected NPC(s) will freeze in place (or unfreeze). If there are no selected NPCs, uses the NPC under the crosshair.
	Arguments:	-none-

name: npc_freeze_unselected
help: Freeze all NPCs not selected

name: npc_thinknow
help: Trigger NPC to think

name: npc_teleport
help:
Selected NPC will teleport to the location that the player is looking (shown with a purple box)
	Arguments:	-none-

name: npc_go_do_run
help: Set whether should run on NPC go

name: npc_go
help:
Selected NPC(s) will go to the location that the player is looking (shown with a purple box)
	Arguments:	-none-

name: npc_go_random
help:
Sends all selected NPC(s) to a random node.
	Arguments:   	-none-

name: npc_reset
help:
Reloads schedules for all NPC's from their script files
	Arguments:	-none-

name: npc_nearest
help:
Draw's a while box around the NPC(s) nearest node
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_route
help:
Displays the current route of the given NPC as a line on the screen.  Waypoints along the route are drawn as small cyan rectangles.  Line is color coded in the following manner:
	Blue	- path to a node
	Cyan	- detour around an object (triangulation)
	Red	- jump
	Maroon - path to final target position
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc_class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_select
help:
Select or deselects the given NPC(s) for later manipulation.  Selected NPC's are shown surrounded by a red translucent box
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_combat
help:
Displays text debugging information about the squad and enemy of the selected NPC  (See Overlay Text)
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_squads
help: Obsolete.  Replaced by npc_combat

name: npc_tasks
help:
Displays detailed text debugging information about the all the tasks of the selected NPC current schedule (See Overlay Text)
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_task_text
help:
Outputs text debugging information to the console about the all the tasks + break conditions of the selected NPC current schedule
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_conditions
help:
Displays all the current AI conditions that an NPC has in the overlay text.
	Arguments:   	{npc_name} / {npc class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_viewcone
help:
Displays the viewcone of the NPC (where they are currently looking and what the extents of there vision is)
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_relationships
help:
Displays the relationships between this NPC and all others.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_steering
help:
Displays the steering obstructions of the NPC (used to perform local avoidance)
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: npc_steering_all
help: Displays the steering obstructions of all NPCs (used to perform local avoidance)

name: npc_heal
help: Heals the target back to full health

name: npc_ammo_deplete
help: Subtracts half of the target's ammo

name: ai_clear_bad_links
help: Clears bits set on nav links indicating link is unusable

name: ai_test_los
help: Test AI LOS from the player's POV

name: ainet_generate_report
help: Generate a report to the console.

name: ainet_generate_report_only
help: Generate a report to the console.

name: ai_debug_eventresponses
help: Set to 1 to see all NPC response events trigger, and which NPCs choose to respond to them.

name: ai_drop_hint
help: Drop an ai_hint at the player's current eye position.

name: ai_set_move_height_epsilon
help: Set how high AI bumps up ground walkers when checking steps

name: ai_debug_node_connect
help: Debug the attempted connection between two nodes

name: sk_ally_regen_time
help: Time taken for an ally to regenerate a point of health.

name: sv_npc_talker_maxdist
help: NPCs over this distance from the player won't attempt to speak.

name: rr_debug_qa
help: Set to 1 to see debug related to the Question & Answer system used to create conversations between allied NPCs.

name: rr_debugresponses
help: Show verbose matching output (1 for simple, 2 for rule scoring). If set to 3, it will only show response success/failure for npc_selected NPCs.

name: rr_debugrule
help: If set to the name of the rule, that rule's score will be shown whenever a concept is passed into the response rules system.

name: rr_dumpresponses
help: Dump all response_rules.txt and rules (requires restart)

name: rr_reloadresponsesystems
help: Reload all response system scripts.

name: npc_speakall
help: Force the npc to try and speak all their responses

name: sv_showanimstate
help: Show the (server) animation state for the specified entity (-1 for none).

name: sv_showanimstate_log
help: 1 to output sv_showanimstate to Msg(). 2 to store in AnimStateServer.log. 3 for both.

name: mp_feetyawrate
help: How many degrees per second that we can turn our feet or upper body.

name: mp_facefronttime
help: After this amount of time of standing in place but aiming to one side, go ahead and move feet to face upper body.

name: mp_ik
help: Use IK on in-place turns.

name: npc_height_adjust
help: Enable test mode for ik height adjustment

name: sv_pvsskipanimation
help: Skips SetupBones when npc's are outside the PVS

name: ai_setupbones_debug
help: Shows that bones that are setup every think

name: sv_netvisdist
help: Test networking visibility distance

name: ai_debug_los
help: NPC Line-Of-Sight debug mode. If 1, solid entities that block NPC LOC will be highlighted with white bounding boxes. If 2, it'll show non-solid entities that would do it if they were solid.

name: ent_messages_draw
help: Visualizes all entity input/output activity.

name: ent_text
help:
Displays text debugging information about the given entity(ies) on top of the entity (See Overlay Text)
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_bbox
help:
Displays the movement bounding box for the given entity(ies) in orange.  Some entites will also display entity specific overlays.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_absbox
help:
Displays the total bounding box for the given entity(s) in green.  Some entites will also display entity specific overlays.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_rbox
help:
Displays the total bounding box for the given entity(s) in green.  Some entites will also display entity specific overlays.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_attachments
help:
Displays the attachment points on an entity.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_viewoffset
help:
Displays the eye position for the given entity(ies) in red.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_remove
help:
Removes the given entity(s)
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_remove_all
help:
Removes all entities of the specified type
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name}

name: ent_setname
help:
Sets the targetname of the given entity(s)
	Arguments:   	{new entity name} {entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: find_ent
help:
Find and list all entities with classnames or targetnames that contain the specified substring.
Format: find_ent <substring>

name: find_ent_index
help:
Display data for entity matching specified index.
Format: find_ent_index <index>

name: ent_dump
help:
Usage:
   ent_dump <entity name>

name: ent_fire
help:
Usage:
   ent_fire <target> [action] [value] [delay]

name: ent_cancelpendingentfires
help: Cancels all ent_fire created outputs that are currently waiting for their delay to expire.

name: ent_info
help:
Usage:
   ent_info <class name>

name: ent_messages
help:
Toggles input/output message display for the selected entity(ies).  The name of the entity will be displayed as well as any messages that it sends or receives.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_pause
help: Toggles pausing of input/output message processing for entities.  When turned on processing of all message will stop.  Any messages displayed with 'ent_messages' will stop fading and be displayed indefinitely. To step through the messages one by one use 'ent_step'.

name: picker
help:
Toggles 'picker' mode.  When picker is on, the bounding box, pivot and debugging text is displayed for whatever entity the player is looking at.
	Arguments:	full - enables all debug information

name: ent_pivot
help:
Displays the pivot for the given entity(ies).
	(y=up=green, z=forward=blue, x=left=red). 
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_step
help: When 'ent_pause' is set this will step through one waiting input / output message at a time.

name: ent_show_response_criteria
help:
Print, to the console, an entity's current criteria set used to select responses.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_autoaim
help:
Displays the entity's autoaim radius.
	Arguments:   	{entity_name} / {class_name} / no argument picks what player is looking at

name: ent_create
help: Creates an entity of the given type where the player is looking.

name: ent_teleport
help:
Teleport the specified entity to where the player is looking.
	Format: ent_teleport <entity name>

name: ent_orient
help:
Orient the specified entity to match the player's angles. By default, only orients target entity's YAW. Use the 'allangles' option to orient on all axis.
	Format: ent_orient <entity name> <optional: allangles>

name: scene_showlook
help: When playing back, show the directions of look events.

name: scene_showmoveto
help: When moving, show the end location.

name: scene_showunlock
help: Show when a vcd is playing but normal AI is running.

name: ai_expression_optimization
help: Disable npc background expressions when you can't see them.

name: ai_expression_frametime
help: Maximum frametime to still play background expressions.

name: sv_debug_player_use
help: Visualizes +use logic. Green cross=trace success, Red cross=trace too far, Green box=radius success

name: smoothstairs
help: Smooth player eye z coordinate when traversing stairs.

name: anim_3wayblend
help: Toggle the 3-way animation blending code.

name: dumpeventqueue
help: Dump the contents of the Entity I/O event queue to the console.

name: cast_ray
help: Tests collision detection

name: cast_hull
help: Tests hull collision detection

name: drawline
help:
Draws line between two 3D Points.
	Green if no collision
	Red is collides with something
	Arguments: x1 y1 z1 x2 y2 z2

name: drawcross
help:
Draws a cross at the given location
	Arguments: x y z

name: kill
help: Kills the player with generic damage

name: explode
help: Kills the player with explosive damage

name: killvector
help: Kills a player applying force. Usage: killvector <player> <x value> <y value> <z value>

name: explodevector
help: Kills a player applying an explosive force. Usage: explodevector <player> <x value> <y value> <z value>

name: buddha
help: Toggle.  Player takes damage but won't die. (Shows red cross when health is zero)

name: say
help: Display player message

name: say_team
help: Display player message to team

name: give
help:
Give item to player.
	Arguments: <item_name>

name: fov
help: Change players FOV

name: setmodel
help: Changes's player's model

name: test_dispatcheffect
help:
Test a clientside dispatch effect.
	Usage: test_dispatcheffect <effect name> <distance away> <flags> <magnitude> <scale>
	Defaults are: <distance 1024> <flags 0> <magnitude 0> <scale 0>

name: phys_swap
help: Automatically swaps the current weapon for the physcannon and back again.

name: bug_swap
help: Automatically swaps the current weapon for the bug bait and back again.

name: use
help:
Use a particular weapon	
Arguments: <weapon_name>

name: noclip
help: Toggle. Player becomes non-solid and flies.

name: god
help: Toggle. Player becomes invulnerable.

name: setpos
help: Move player to specified origin (must have sv_cheats).

name: setang
help: Snap player eyes to specified pitch yaw <roll:optional> (must have sv_cheats).

name: setpos_exact
help: Move player to an exact specified origin (must have sv_cheats).

name: setang_exact
help: Snap player eyes and orientation to specified pitch yaw <roll:optional> (must have sv_cheats).

name: notarget
help: Toggle. Player becomes hidden to NPCs.

name: hurtme
help:
Hurts the player.
	Arguments: <health to lose>

name: groundlist
help: Display ground entity list <index>

name: commentary_available
help: Automatically set by the game when a commentary file is available for the current map.

name: commentary
help: Desired commentary mode state.

name: bloodspray
help: blood

name: test_entity_blocker
help: Test command that drops an entity blocker out in front of the player.

name: respawn_entities
help: Respawn all the entities in the map.

name: report_entities
help: Lists all entities

name: report_touchlinks
help: Lists all touchlinks

name: report_simthinklist
help: Lists all simulating/thinking entities

name: dbghist_addline
help: Add a line to the debug history. Format: <category id> <line>

name: dbghist_dump
help:
Dump the debug history to the console. Format: <category id>
    Categories:
     0: Entity I/O
     1: AI Decisions
     2: Scene Print
     3: Alyx Blind
     4: Log of damage done to player

name: fadeout
help: fadeout {time r g b}: Fades the screen to black or to the specified color over the given number of seconds.

name: fadein
help: fadein {time r g b}: Fades the screen in from black or from the specified color over the given number of seconds.

name: shake
help: Shake the screen.

name: fish_dormant
help: Turns off interactive fish behavior. Fish become immobile and unresponsive.

name: sv_showladders
help: Show bbox and dismount points for all ladders (must be set before level load.)

name: sv_force_transmit_ents
help: Will transmit all entities to client, regardless of PVS conditions (will still skip based on transmit flags, however).

name: sv_showhitboxes
help: Send server-side hitboxes for specified entity to client (NOTE:  this uses lots of bandwidth, use on listen server only).

name: motdfile
help: The MOTD file to load.

name: xc_uncrouch_on_jump
help: Uncrouch when jump occurs

name: _resetgamestats
help: Erases current game stats and writes out a blank stats file

name: dumpgamestringtable
help: Dump the contents of the game string table to the console.

name: mp_forcecamera
help: Restricts spectator modes for dead players

name: mp_allowspectators
help: toggles whether the server allows spectator mode or not

name: dump_globals
help: Dump all global entities/states

name: server_game_time
help: Gives the game time in seconds (server's curtime)

name: sv_clearhinthistory
help: Clear memory of server side hints displayed to the player.

name: tv_delay
help: SourceTV broadcast delay in seconds

name: tv_allow_static_shots
help: Auto director uses fixed level cameras for shots

name: tv_allow_camera_man
help: Auto director allows spectators to become camera man

name: global_set
help: global_set <globalname> <state>: Sets the state of the given env_global (0 = OFF, 1 = ON, 2 = DEAD).

name: sv_gravity
help: World gravity.

name: sv_stopspeed
help: Minimum stopping speed when on ground.

name: sv_footsteps
help: Play footstep sound for players

name: sv_rollangle
help: Max view roll angle

name: sv_friction
help: World friction.

name: sv_bounce
help: Bounce multiplier for when physically simulated objects collide with other objects.

name: sv_maxvelocity
help: Maximum speed any ballistically moving object is allowed to attain per axis.

name: sv_skyname
help: Current name of the skybox texture

name: sv_backspeed
help: How much to slow down backwards motion

name: sv_waterdist
help: Vertical view fixup when eyes are near water plane.

name: mp_chattime
help: amount of time players can chat after the game is over

name: mp_timelimit
help: game time per map in minutes

name: tv_delaymapchange
help: Delays map change until broadcast is complete

name: mp_restartgame
help: If non-zero, game will restart in the specified number of seconds

name: mp_waitingforplayers_time
help: WaitingForPlayers time length in seconds

name: mp_waitingforplayers_restart
help: Set to 1 to start or restart the WaitingForPlayers period.

name: mp_waitingforplayers_cancel
help: Set to 1 to end the WaitingForPlayers period.

name: mp_clan_readyrestart
help: If non-zero, game will restart once someone from each team gives the ready signal

name: mp_clan_ready_signal
help: Text that team leader from each team must speak for the match to begin

name: nav_split_place_on_ground
help: If true, nav areas will be placed flush with the ground when split.

name: nav_area_bgcolor
help: RGBA color to draw as the background color for nav areas while editing.

name: nav_corner_adjust_adjacent
help: radius used to raise/lower corners in nearby areas when raising/lowering corners.

name: nav_update_blocked
help: Updates the blocked/unblocked status for every nav area.

name: nav_check_floor
help: Updates the blocked/unblocked status for every nav area.

name: nav_show_area_info
help: Duration in seconds to show nav area ID and attributes while editing

name: nav_snap_to_grid
help: Snap to the nav generation grid when creating new nav areas

name: nav_create_place_on_ground
help: If true, nav areas will be placed flush with the ground when created by hand.

name: nav_check_file_consistency
help: Scans the maps directory and reports any missing/out-of-date navigation files.

name: nav_slope_limit
help: The ground unit normal's Z component must be greater than this for nav areas to be generated.

name: nav_restart_after_analysis
help: When nav nav_restart_after_analysis finishes, restart the server.  Turning this off can cause crashes, but is useful for incremental generation.

name: nav_edit
help: Set to one to interactively edit the Navigation Mesh. Set to zero to leave edit mode.

name: nav_quicksave
help: Set to one to skip the time consuming phases of the analysis.  Useful for data collection and testing.

name: nav_show_approach_points
help: Show Approach Points in the Navigation Mesh.

name: nav_show_danger
help: Show current 'danger' levels.

name: nav_show_player_counts
help: Show current player counts in each area.

name: nav_remove_unused_jump_areas
help: Removes jump areas with at most 1 connection to a ladder or non-jump area.

name: nav_delete
help: Deletes the currently highlighted Area.

name: nav_delete_marked
help: Deletes the currently marked Area (if any).

name: nav_split
help: To split an Area into two, align the split line using your cursor and invoke the split command.

name: nav_make_sniper_spots
help: Chops the marked area into disconnected sub-areas suitable for sniper spots.

name: nav_merge
help: To merge two Areas into one, mark the first Area, highlight the second by pointing your cursor at it, and invoke the merge command.

name: nav_mark
help: Marks the Area or Ladder under the cursor for manipulation by subsequent editing commands.

name: nav_unmark
help: Clears the marked Area or Ladder.

name: nav_begin_area
help: Defines a corner of a new Area or Ladder. To complete the Area or Ladder, drag the opposite corner to the desired location and issue a 'nav_end_area' command.

name: nav_end_area
help: Defines the second corner of a new Area or Ladder and creates it.

name: nav_connect
help: To connect two Areas, mark the first Area, highlight the second Area, then invoke the connect command. Note that this creates a ONE-WAY connection from the first to the second Area. To make a two-way connection, also connect the second area to the first.

name: nav_disconnect
help: To disconnect two Areas, mark an Area, highlight a second Area, then invoke the disconnect command. This will remove all connections between the two Areas.

name: nav_splice
help: To splice, mark an area, highlight a second area, then invoke the splice command to create a new, connected area between them.

name: nav_crouch
help: Toggles the 'must crouch in this area' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_precise
help: Toggles the 'dont avoid obstacles' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_jump
help: Toggles the 'traverse this area by jumping' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_no_jump
help: Toggles the 'dont jump in this area' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_stop
help: Toggles the 'must stop when entering this area' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_walk
help: Toggles the 'traverse this area by walking' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_run
help: Toggles the 'traverse this area by running' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_avoid
help: Toggles the 'avoid this area when possible' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_transient
help: Toggles the 'area is transient and may become blocked' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_dont_hide
help: Toggles the 'area is not suitable for hiding spots' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_stand
help: Toggles the 'stand while hiding' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_no_hostages
help: Toggles the 'hostages cannot use this area' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_strip
help: Strips all Hiding Spots, Approach Points, and Encounter Spots from the current Area.

name: nav_save
help: Saves the current Navigation Mesh to disk.

name: nav_load
help: Loads the Navigation Mesh for the current map.

name: nav_use_place
help: If used without arguments, all available Places will be listed. If a Place argument is given, the current Place is set.

name: nav_place_replace
help: Replaces all instances of the first place with the second place.

name: nav_place_list
help: Lists all place names used in the map.

name: nav_toggle_place_mode
help: Toggle the editor into and out of Place mode. Place mode allows labelling of Area with Place names.

name: nav_set_place_mode
help: Sets the editor into or out of Place mode. Place mode allows labelling of Area with Place names.

name: nav_place_floodfill
help: Sets the Place of the Area under the cursor to the curent Place, and 'flood-fills' the Place to all adjacent Areas. Flood-filling stops when it hits an Area with the same Place, or a different Place than that of the initial Area.

name: nav_place_pick
help: Sets the current Place to the Place of the Area under the cursor.

name: nav_toggle_place_painting
help: Toggles Place Painting mode. When Place Painting, pointing at an Area will 'paint' it with the current Place.

name: nav_mark_unnamed
help: Mark an Area with no Place name. Useful for finding stray areas missed when Place Painting.

name: nav_corner_select
help: Select a corner of the currently marked Area. Use multiple times to access all four corners.

name: ai_debug_actbusy

Used to debug actbusy behavior. Usage:
1: Constantly draw lines from NPCs to the actbusy nodes they've chosen to actbusy at.
2: Whenever an NPC makes a decision to use an actbusy, show which actbusy they've chosen.
3: Selected NPCs (with npc_select) will report why they're not choosing actbusy nodes.
4: Display debug output of actbusy logic.
5: Display safe zone volumes and info.

name: sv_logsdir
help: Folder in the game directory where server logs will be stored.

name: sv_logfile
help: Log server information in the log file.

name: sv_logflush
help: Flush the log file to disk on each write (slow).

name: sv_logecho
help: Echo log information to the console.

name: sv_log_onefile
help: Log server information to only one file.

name: sv_logbans
help: Log server bans in the server logs.

name: log
help: Enables logging to file, console, and udp < on | off >.

name: logaddress_add
help: Set address and port for remote host <ip:port>.

name: logaddress_delall
help: Remove all udp addresses being logged to

name: logaddress_del
help: Remove address and port for remote host <ip:port>.

name: logaddress_list
help: List all addresses currently being used by logaddress.

name: sv_pure
help: Show user data.

name: sv_pure_kick_clients
help: If set to 1, the server will kick clients with mismatching files. Otherwise, it will issue a warning to the client.

name: sv_pure_trace
help: If set to 1, the server will print a message whenever a client is verifying a CRC for a file.

name: sv_cheats
help: Allow cheats on server

name: sv_lan
help: Server is a lan server ( no heartbeat, no authentication, no non-class C addresses )

name: sv_pausable
help: Is the server pausable.

name: sv_contact
help: Contact email for server sysop

name: sv_cacheencodedents
help: If set to 1, does an optimization to prevent extra SendTable_Encode calls.

name: sv_voicecodec
help: Specifies which voice codec DLL to use in a game. Set to the name of the DLL without the extension.

name: sv_downloadurl
help: Location from which clients can download missing files

name: sv_consistency
help: Whether the server enforces file consistency for critical files

name: sv_maxreplay
help: Maximum replay time in seconds

name: sv_mincmdrate
help: This sets the minimum value for cl_cmdrate. 0 == unlimited.

name: sv_maxcmdrate
help: (If sv_mincmdrate is > 0), this sets the maximum value for cl_cmdrate.

name: sv_client_cmdrate_difference
help: cl_cmdrate is moved to within sv_client_cmdrate_difference units of cl_updaterate before it is clamped between sv_mincmdrate and sv_maxcmdrate.

name: sv_client_min_interp_ratio
help:
This can be used to limit the value of cl_interp_ratio for connected clients (only while they are connected).
              -1 = let clients set cl_interp_ratio to anything
 any other value = set minimum value for cl_interp_ratio

name: sv_client_max_interp_ratio
help: This can be used to limit the value of cl_interp_ratio for connected clients (only while they are connected). If sv_client_min_interp_ratio is -1, then this cvar has no effect.

name: sv_client_predict
help:
This can be used to force the value of cl_predict for connected clients (only while they are connected).
   -1 = let clients set cl_predict to anything
    0 = force cl_predict to 0
    1 = force cl_predict to 1

name: tv_enable
help: Activates SourceTV on server.

name: user
help: Show user data.

name: users
help: Show user info for players on server.

name: maxplayers
help: Change the maximum number of players allowed on this server.

help: add/remove/enable/disable master servers

name: heartbeat

name: sv_debugmanualmode

help: unpauses all disabled plugins

help: plugin_unload <index> : unloads a plugin
